member.name: T:SQLite.Designer.SQLiteAdapterDesigner
member.summary: The purpose of this class is to provide context menus and event support when designing a SQLite DataSet. Most of the functionality is implemented by MS's VSDesigner object which we instantiate through reflection since I don't really have a design-time reference to the object and many of the objects in VSDesigner are internal.

member.name: M:SQLite.Designer.SQLiteAdapterDesigner.#ctor
member.summary: Empty constructor

member.name: M:SQLite.Designer.SQLiteAdapterDesigner.Initialize(System.ComponentModel.IComponent)
member.summary: Initialize the designer by creating a SqlDataAdapterDesigner and delegating most of our functionality to it.

member.summary: We extend support for DbDataAdapter-derived objects
member.param: The object wanting to be extended
member.returns: Whether or not we extend that object

member.summary: Forwards to the SqlDataAdapterDesigner object

member.summary: Forwards to the SqlDataAdapterDesigner object

member.name: T:SQLite.Designer.SQLiteCommandDesigner
member.summary: This object provides a designer for a SQLiteCommand. The reason we provide an additional CommandDesignTimeVisible property is because certain MS designer components will look for it and fail if its not there.

member.summary: Initialize the instance with the given SQLiteCommand component

member.summary: Add our designtimevisible attribute to the attributes for the item

member.summary: Provide a get method for the CommandDesignTimeVisible provided property
member.param: The SQLiteCommand we're designing for
member.returns: True or false if the object is visible in design mode

member.summary: Provide a set method for our supplied CommandDesignTimeVisible property
member.param: The SQLiteCommand to set
The new designtime visible property to assign to the command

member.summary: We extend any DbCommand

member.returns: True if the object derives from DbCommand

member.summary: This method executes a specified command, potentially based on parameters passed in from the data view support XML.

member.name: T:SQLite.Designer.SQLiteConnectionProperties
member.summary: Provides rudimentary connectionproperties support

member.name: T:SQLite.Designer.SQLiteConnectionStringEditor
member.summary:
This class provides connectionstring editing support in the properties window when using a SQLiteConnection as a toolbox component on a form (for example).
In order to provide the dropdown list, unless someone knows a better way, I have to use the internal VsConnectionManager class since it utilizes some interfaces in the designer that are internal to the VSDesigner object. We instantiate it and utilize it through reflection.

member.name: T:SQLite.Designer.SQLiteConnectionUIControl
member.summary: Provides a UI to edit/create SQLite database connections

member.summary: Required designer variable.

member.summary: Clean up any resources being used.
member.param: true if managed resources should be disposed; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:SQLite.Designer.SQLiteConnectionUIControl.InitializeComponent
member.summary: Required method for Designer support - do not modify the contents of this method with the code editor.

member.name: T:SQLite.Designer.SQLiteDataAdapterToolboxItem
member.summary:
Provides a toolboxitem for a SQLiteDataAdapter. This is required in order for us to pop up the connection wizard when you drop the tool on a form, and to create the hidden commands that are assigned to the data adapter and keep them hidden. The hiding at runtime of the controls is accomplished both here during the creation of the components and in the SQLiteCommandDesigner which provides properties to hide the objects when they're supposed to be hidden.
The connection wizard is instantiated in the VSDesigner through reflection.

member.name: M:SQLite.Designer.SQLiteDataAdapterToolboxItem.CreateComponentsCore(System.ComponentModel.Design.IDesignerHost)
member.summary: Creates the necessary components associated with this data adapter instance
member.param: The designer host
member.returns: The components created by this toolbox item

member.name: M:SQLite.Designer.SQLiteDataAdapterToolboxItem.GenerateName(System.ComponentModel.IContainer,System.String)
member.summary: Generates a unique name for the given object
member.param: The container where we're being instantiated
The core name of the object to create a unique instance of
member.returns: A unique name within the given container

member.name: T:SQLite.Designer.SQLiteDataConnectionSupport
member.summary: This class creates many of the DDEX components when asked for by the server explorer.

member.name: T:SQLite.Designer.SQLiteDataObjectIdentifierResolver
member.summary: This class is used to build identifier arrays and contract them. Typically they are passed to SQLiteConnection.GetSchema() or are contracted for display on the screen or in the properties window.

member.name: M:SQLite.Designer.SQLiteDataObjectIdentifierResolver.QuickContractIdentifier(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Strips out the schema, which we don't really support but has to be there for certain operations internal to MS's designer implementation.
member.param: The type of identifier to contract
The full identifier array
member.returns: A contracted identifier array

member.name: M:SQLite.Designer.SQLiteDataObjectIdentifierResolver.Microsoft#VisualStudio#OLE#Interop#IObjectWithSite#GetSite(System.Guid@,System.IntPtr@)
member.summary: GetSite does not need to be implemented since DDEX only calls SetSite to site the object.

member.name: T:SQLite.Designer.SQLiteDataObjectSupport
member.summary: Doesn't do much other than provide the DataObjectSupport base object with a location where the XML resource can be found.

member.name: T:SQLite.Designer.SQLiteDataSourceInformation
member.summary: Provides basic DataSourceInformation about the underlying connection

member.name: T:SQLite.Designer.SQLiteDataViewSupport
member.summary: Provides DataViewSupport with a location where the XML file is for the Server Explorer's view.

member.name: T:SQLite.Designer.SQLiteOptions
member.summary: This class keeps track of the options configured on a per-solution file basis pertaining to the System.Data.SQLite design-time components.

member.name: F:SQLite.Designer.SQLiteOptions.ProviderNameKey
member.summary: This is the name of the setting containing the configured ADO.NET provider name.

member.name: F:SQLite.Designer.SQLiteOptions.ProviderNameEnvVarName
member.summary: This is the name of the environment variable that will be checked prior to setting the initial default value for the configured ADO.NET provider name, thus allowing the default value to be overridden via the environment.

member.name: F:SQLite.Designer.SQLiteOptions.LegacyProviderName
member.summary: This is the legacy provider name used by the System.Data.SQLite design-time components. It is also the default value for the associated option key.

member.name: F:SQLite.Designer.SQLiteOptions.syncRoot
member.summary: This is used to synchronize access to the static dictionary of options and objects.

member.name: F:SQLite.Designer.SQLiteOptions.options
member.summary: This dictionary contains the key/value pairs representing the per-solution options configured for the current solution. When a new solution is loaded by Visual Studio, this dictionary must be reset.

member.name: F:SQLite.Designer.SQLiteOptions.dbProviderFactories
member.summary: This dictionary contains the objects cached by this class.

member.name: M:SQLite.Designer.SQLiteOptions.Initialize(System.Boolean)
member.summary: This method initializes (or resets) the per-solution configuration options.
member.param: Non-zero to reset the options if they are already initialized. When this method is called from the constructor, this value should always be true.

member.name: M:SQLite.Designer.SQLiteOptions.GetProviderName
member.summary: This method determines the name of the ADO.NET provider for the System.Data.SQLite design-time components to use.
member.returns: The configured ADO.NET provider name for System.Data.SQLite -OR- the default ADO.NET provider name for System.Data.SQLite in the event of any failure. This method cannot return null.

member.name: M:SQLite.Designer.SQLiteOptions.GetProviderName(System.String)
member.summary: This method determines the name of the ADO.NET provider for the System.Data.SQLite design-time components to use.
member.param: The value to return from this method if the name of the ADO.NET provider is unavailable or cannot be determined.
member.returns: The configured ADO.NET provider name for System.Data.SQLite -OR- the default ADO.NET provider name for System.Data.SQLite in the event of any failure.

member.name: M:SQLite.Designer.SQLiteOptions.SetProviderName(System.String)
member.summary: This method attempts to set the name of the ADO.NET provider for the System.Data.SQLite design-time components to use.
member.param: The ADO.NET provider name to use.
member.returns: Non-zero upon success; otherwise, zero. All ADO.NET provider names unknown to this class are rejected.

member.name: M:SQLite.Designer.SQLiteOptions.SelectProviderName(System.Windows.Forms.ComboBox)
member.summary: This method attempts to select the configured ADO.NET provider name in the specified . This method will only work correctly when called from the user-interface thread.
member.param: The object where the selection is to be modified.
member.returns: Non-zero upon success; otherwise, zero.

member.name: M:SQLite.Designer.SQLiteOptions.CheckProviderName(System.String)
member.summary: Determines if the specified ADO.NET provider name appears to be usable.
member.param: The invariant name of the ADO.NET provider to create. Using null or an empty string will cause this method to return false.
member.returns: Non-zero if the was created or queried successfully; otherwise, zero.

member.name: M:SQLite.Designer.SQLiteOptions.GetProviderFactory(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Data.Common.DbProviderFactory@)
member.summary: Gets the cached object associated with the specified name, creating a new instance if necessary.
member.param: The invariant name of the ADO.NET provider to create. Using null or an empty string will cause this method to return false.
Non-zero to create a new instance of the ADO.NET provider, if necessary.
The newly created object or null if it is unavailable or could not be created.
member.returns: Non-zero if the was created or queried successfully; otherwise, zero.

member.name: M:SQLite.Designer.SQLiteOptions.AddProviderNames(System.Windows.Forms.ComboBox.ObjectCollection)
member.summary: This method populates the specified item list with the recognized ADO.NET provider names. This method will only work correctly when called from the user-interface thread.
member.param: The property value containing the list of items to be modified. This value cannot be null.
member.returns: The number of items actually added to the list, which may be zero.

member.name: M:SQLite.Designer.SQLiteOptions.IsDefaultValue(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: This method determines if the specified key/value pair represents the default value for that option.
member.param: The name ("key") of the configuration option.
The value of the configuration option.
member.returns: Non-zero if the key/value pair represents its default value.

member.name: M:SQLite.Designer.SQLiteOptions.IsValidValue(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: This method determines if the specified key/value pair is valid and supported by this class.
member.param: The name ("key") of the configuration option.
The value of the configuration option.
member.returns: Non-zero if the key/value pair represents a valid option key and value supported by this class.

member.name: M:SQLite.Designer.SQLiteOptions.GetKeys(System.Boolean)
member.summary: This method returns the current list of option keys supported by the System.Data.SQLite design-time components.
member.returns: An of strings containing the list of option keys supported by the System.Data.SQLite design-time components -OR- null in the event of any failure.

member.name: M:SQLite.Designer.SQLiteOptions.HaveKey(System.String)
member.summary: This method determines if the specified option key is supported by this class.
member.param: The name ("key") of the configuration option.
member.returns: Non-zero if the specified option key is supported by this class.

member.name: M:SQLite.Designer.SQLiteOptions.GetValue(System.String,System.String@)
member.summary: This method attempts to query and return the current value of the specified option key.
member.param: The name ("key") of the configuration option.
Upon success, the current value for the configuration option; otherwise, null.
member.returns: Non-zero for success; otherwise, zero.

member.name: M:SQLite.Designer.SQLiteOptions.SetValue(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: This method attempts to set the value of the specified option key.
member.param: The name ("key") of the configuration option.
The new value for the configuration option.
member.returns: Non-zero for success; otherwise, zero.

member.name: M:SQLite.Designer.SQLiteOptions.ReadValue(System.IO.Stream,System.String@)
member.summary: This method attempts to read an option value from the specified stream. The stream must be readable. After this method returns, the stream may no longer be usable.
member.param: The stream to read the option value from.
Upon success, the read value for the configuration option; otherwise, null.
member.returns: Non-zero for success; otherwise, zero.

member.name: M:SQLite.Designer.SQLiteOptions.WriteValue(System.IO.Stream,System.String)
member.summary: This method attempts to write an option value to the specified stream. The stream must be writable. After this method returns, the stream may no longer be usable.
member.param: The stream to write the option value to.
The option value to be written. This value may be null.
member.returns: Non-zero for success; otherwise, zero.

member.name: T:SQLite.Designer.SQLitePackage
member.summary: Ideally we'd be a package provider, but the VS Express Editions don't support us, so this class exists so that in the future we can perhaps work with the Express Editions.

member.summary: For a package-based provider, this factory creates instances of the main objects we support

member.name: P:SQLite.Designer.VSPackage.ResourceManager
member.summary: Returns the cached ResourceManager instance used by this class.

member.name: P:SQLite.Designer.VSPackage.Culture
member.summary: Overrides the current thread's CurrentUICulture property for all resource lookups using this strongly typed resource class.

member.name: P:SQLite.Designer.VSPackage._400
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to PTA9I2P3DHDAHKKZHZHJMDEQCCPTQCRMDZC9DAARARZHZCHPDEPQZAJ0JZECKJQJJ0DCDDA3AEEPEHRJHMAIAPQHDEEHRCZQE2DHKKQTK0DTQ9C2E9C9R8ZCKPK3RRK2.

member.name: P:SQLite.Designer.VSPackage.Decrypt
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The database and its metadata will be un-encrypted. No password will be required to open the database and view its contents..

member.name: P:SQLite.Designer.VSPackage.Encrypt
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The database and its metadata will be encrypted using the supplied password as a hash..

member.name: P:SQLite.Designer.VSPackage.ReEncrypt
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The database and its metadata will be re-encrypted using the supplied password as a hash..

member.name: P:SQLite.Designer.VSPackage.ToolboxItems
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to [SQLite] System.Data.SQLite.SQLiteConnection, System.Data.SQLite System.Data.SQLite.SQLiteDataAdapter, System.Data.SQLite System.Data.SQLite.SQLiteCommand, System.Data.SQLite .
